description: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information in the Episode Files section of the first episode for curriculum, exam offers Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode** The Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) was created to help businesses manage their IT operations more efficiently and reliably. The ITIL framework provides a collection of practices that businesses can choose to adopt that focus on aligning IT operations with the goals of the business. These practices range from creating new service offerings to day-to-day operations and managing incidents. Many organizations choose to follow ITIL because it prevents them from having to "reinvent the wheel" when it comes to IT processes and operations. The ITIL Foundations certification is designed to introduce the candidate to the general processes in ITIL and how they can be used to benefit an organization.
descriptionMD: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information [HERE](https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITIL_OVERVIEW.zip)  Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode**  For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com). The Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) was created to help businesses manage their IT operations more efficiently and reliably. The ITIL framework provides a collection of practices that businesses can choose to adopt that focus on aligning IT operations with the goals of the business. These practices range from creating new service offerings to day-to-day operations and managing incidents. Many organizations choose to follow ITIL because it prevents them from having to "reinvent the wheel" when it comes to IT processes and operations. The ITIL Foundations certification is designed to introduce the candidate to the general processes in ITIL and how they can be used to benefit an organization.
name: Accredited ITIL Foundation
subtitle: Foundation

episodes.description: ** Download the Episode Files for information available from our partner PassionIT Group ** In this episode, Daniel and Terry give a general overview of what to expect in the upcoming ITIL Foundation series. They cover topics like who is the intended audience, what the scope of the series will cover, and what are some specific topics that will be addressed. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please contact PassionIT Group info@passionitgroup.com.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: ** Download the Episode Files for the information referenced in this course ** In this episode, Daniel and Terry begin their foray into the wonderful world of ITIL Foundation. Here they give you an overview of the topics discussed in the ITIL framework, define ITIL as an entity, and start their discussion of the ITIL Service Lifecycle. They also introduce you to the first of many key concepts and definitions used by ITIL Foundation.
episodes.title: Introduction to ITIL Foundation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry continue their introduction into ITIL Foundation; picking back up with more key concepts and definitions. This includes the Process Model, RACI, Process Owner, Manager, Practitioner, and Service Owner.
episodes.title: Introduction to ITIL Foundation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry describe the first of the 5 stages of the Service Lifecycle known as Service Strategy. They discuss the definition, purpose, objectives, and scope as well as key concepts/definitions and processes.
episodes.title: Service Strategy

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Service Design, the second of five Service Lifecycle stages. Here they begin talking about the objectives and scope of the Service Design stage and then take a close look at 2 of the 8 Service Design processes, Design Coordination and Service Level Management.
episodes.title: Service Design

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Service Design, the second of five Service Lifecycle stages. They pick back up by finishing their look into the other 6 Service Design Processes which includes Supplier Management, service Catalog Management, Capacity Management, Availability Management, IT Service Continuity Management, and Information Security Management.
episodes.title: Service Design Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Service Transition, the third of five Service Lifecycle stages. As usual, they define the purpose, scope, and objectives associated with the Service Transition stage and then they dive into the specific processes which include Transition, Planning, and Support, Service Assets, and Configuration Management.
episodes.title: Service Transition

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry continue to discuss Service Transition, the third of five Service Lifecycle stages. They pick back up by finishing their look at the last three processes that comprise Service Transition. This includes Change Management, Release and Deployment Management, and Knowledge Management.
episodes.title: Service Transition Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Service Operation, the fourth of five Service Lifecycle stages. They begin by covering the purpose, objectives, and scope, business value, as well as key concepts/definitions like Events, Alerts, and Incidents. Then they start in on the five processes; here touching on Incident Management and Problem Management.
episodes.title: Service Operation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry continue to discuss Service Operation, the fourth of five Service Lifecycle stages. Here they jump back in the conversation by looking at the last three Service Operation processes. This includes Event Management, Request Fulfillment, and Access Management. They also discuss the 4 functions; Service Desk, Technical Management, Application Management, and IT Operations Management.
episodes.title: Service Operation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Terry discuss Service Improvement, the fifth of five Service Lifecycle stages. As always, the cover purpose, objectives, and scope. Then they jump into key concepts like Critical Success Factors, Key Performance Indicators, Baselines, and Metrics. Finally they discuss the 7 step improvement process.
episodes.title: Continual Service Improvement

episodes.description: In this episode, Terry reviews the Sample Paper C to help the ITIL Foundations candidate with some Exam Preparation.  This particular Sample Paper is also available at the Axelos website for download.
episodes.title: Exam Prep Sample Paper C

episodes.description: In this episode, Terry reviews the Sample Paper D to help the ITIL Foundations candidate with some Exam Preparation.  This particular Sample Paper is not available at the Axelos website for download.  It is available for subscribers only. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please contact PassionIT Group info@passionitgroup.com.
episodes.title: Exam Prep Example Paper D
